title: Honoring Paul Justinger upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Citizen of the Year Award from the Clarence Chamber of Commerce
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Paul Justinger upon the occasion of his
designation as recipient of the Citizen  of  the  Year  Award  from  the
Clarence Chamber of Commerce

WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that the
quality and character of life in the communities across New  York  State
are reflective  of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those individ-
uals who would devote themselves to the welfare of the community and its
citizenry; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Paul Justinger
upon  the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Citizen of the
Year Award from the Clarence Chamber of Commerce, to  be  celebrated  at
its Annual Awards Dinner on Thursday, February 24, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  Originally  from  South Buffalo, New York, and a graduate of
South Park High School and Empire State College,  Paul  Justinger  began
his insurance business on Main Street in Clarence in 1986 and  has since
relocated; and
  WHEREAS,  Paul  Justinger  and his son, Paul, are business partners at
Nickel City Insurance Company in Lancaster; and
  WHEREAS, A member of the  Clarence  Rotary  Club,  Paul  Justinger  is
affiliated with Adopt-a-Highway and the Clarence Chamber of Commerce; he
served as a board member for 10 years and was its President from 1995 to
1997; and
  WHEREAS, A member of the Clarence Newstead Meals-on-Wheels program for
18  years, Paul Justinger serves on the Executive Board of Directors for
the Lancaster High School Academy of Finance, and has  been  a  Clarence
Middle  School  mentor for 10 years; in addition, he serves on the Board
of the Insurance Club of Buffalo; and
  WHEREAS, In addition to his son, Paul, with him through have been  his
wife,  Teresa, daughter, Kristie, as well as his granddaughter, Brianna,
all of whom feel privileged to be a part of his life and rejoice in  his
achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  Paul Justinger's distinguished record merits the recognition
and respectful tribute of this Legislative Body; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Paul  Justinger upon the occasion of his designation as recipient
of the Citizen of the Year Award from the Clarence Chamber of  Commerce;
and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed be trans-
mitted to Paul Justinger.
